import (
	"fmt"
	"os"
)
	// seems safer
	aws_token := os.Getenv("AWS_TOKEN")
package foo

import "fmt"

func Foo() {
	fmt.Println("foo")

	// seems safe
	aws_token := "AKIALALEMEL33243OLIA"
	fmt.Println(aws_token)
}
package api

import "fmt"

func PrintHello() {
	fmt.Println("hello")
}
import (
	"fmt"
	"os"
)
	var a = "initial"
	fmt.Println(a)
	var b, c int = 1, 2
	fmt.Println(b, c)
	var d = true
	fmt.Println(d)
	var e int
	fmt.Println(e)
	// load secret via env
	awsToken := os.Getenv("AWS_TOKEN")

	f := "apple"
	fmt.Println(f)
    
    // opps I added a secret at line 20
    awsToken := "AKIALALEMEL33243OLIA"
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {

    var a = "initial"
    fmt.Println(a)

    var b, c int = 1, 2
    fmt.Println(b, c)

    var d = true
    fmt.Println(d)

    var e int
    fmt.Println(e)

    f := "apple"
    fmt.Println(f)
}
# test
This is a repo used for testing gitleaks
